node.text:
カンボジアのバッタンバン州カムリエン郡の障害者世帯が栽培する家庭菜園。

コロナ禍で、人々の意識が変わったのは確か。

洪水の後で、水はあるので、小さく、少しずつ、多くの品種を育ています。

失敗してもリスクは少なく、成功すれば、自分たちだけでは食べきれないほどの野菜が採れる。

これまで、半分以上の人たちが、栽培した野菜を無料で、ご近所さんにあげていました。

お金の価値では、はかれないこういうつながりが、いざと言う時に助け合える関係性を作れます。

Him Lannさんが、栽培する畑は小さいですが、たくさんの野菜が、そだっていました。

#カンボジア #家庭菜園 #バッタンバン #野菜栽培 #コロナ禍 #Cambodia #Battambang #Kamrieng #smallscalefarming #vegetables

node.text: Here comes the colour, deepening everyday. Looking good in the top rows where hand weeding has happened. The bottoms rows still need a lot of love! Determined to stay away from chemical sprays, for the good of everything. #lavender

node.text:
First line of irrigation’s completed in our second plot! We did a completely different irrigation design on this side. We battled with super low pressure, uneven watering, and dry ends farming on the slope. The beds on oUr first side have been washed out over time due to the slope and we are hoping for a lot less problems on this new plot Nextdoor. Beds seeded and ready to grow some vegetables. 

#bakersfield #bakersfieldfood #bakersfieldca #smallscalefarming #smallfarms #notillfarming #marketgarden #irrigation #wobblers

If you entered our giveaway to win one of two copies of The No-Till Organic Vegetable Farm, we’d like to remind you that subscribers always get 20% off all books. Because @shnate_ness and @rootandtailfarm are the winners; to both of them, congratulations! Your books are on the way. Thanks for entering! For everyone else, it’s a great read, check it out. You can read an excerpt from the book at the link in profile or https://www.growingformarket.com/articles/cover-cropping-notill-systems

🎉O N E  M O N T H  T O  G O🎉⁠
⁠
OK, so we only have one month to go till Christmas, the Christmas rules have been announced and we will be released from #lockdown2 next week! ⁠
⁠
But what we really want to know is: ⁠
⁠
📢What ice cream flavour will you be enjoying after your Christmas meal?⁠
⁠
Would you go for a festive flavour such as our Fig & Brandy?⁠
⁠
Or maybe a creamy Vanilla to go with your indulgent dessert?⁠
⁠
Let us know your flavour of choice in the comments below👇⁠
⁠

We have adjusted Thanksgiving hours THIS WEEK (11/25–11/28). We are open for in-person shopping today, Wednesday 11/25 from 11 AM—6 PM. We'll be closed on Thanksgiving and the day after (11/26–11/27). Have a wonderful  and safe Thanksgiving!
We'll be back open on Saturday 11/28 for our usual Saturday hours (10 AM—4 PM). (We will not have bread, pastries, or deli service this week.) NOTE: We will be limiting store capacity to 6 shoppers at a time in order to promote social distancing. Please shop alone whenever possible to allow more customers in the store at a time. Thank you! .
.

node.text:
Who knew an old bale full of bugs could be such good fun! 😜 
Our piggies love rooting, rolling and wallowing! 🐖 
We think active pigs are healthy, happy pigs.
We also reckon you can taste the difference in their meat. 
These are our traditional Large Whites. They have perky ears, are really hardy, oh and they like to take a chunk out of Jess on the odd occasion!! 😜 
www.grazersofashbyparva.co.uk Click&Collect / Nationwide Delivery 👍
-

UN Climate Dialogues 2020 has brought together leaders in their fields from across the world to deliver one message, ‘Now is our moment to take action’.
Today, I attended a rich workshop.
The Koronivia Joint Work on Agriculture (day2). Thank you to the presenters and questions from the participants. The international engagement for knowledge sharing and knowledge cogeneration was informative and fruitful. 
🌱💚🌎🌍🌏☀️

node.text:
Der Palmkohl war eine unserer erfolgreichsten Kulturen in diesem Jahr. Vor allem unsere Kunden waren von dieser Kultur überrascht da sie fast niemand kannte. Einige lieben ihn jetzt, andere wiederum mögen ihn nicht. Wie das aber mit jedem anderen Gemüse auch ist. Geschmacklich liegt er, wie wir finden, irgendwo zwischen Grünkohl, Kohlrabi und Brokkoli. Einfach gedünstet als Beilage oder wie Grünkohl oder Spinat zubereitet eine tolle Abwechslung für die Küche. 
Von einem Beet haben Wirtin etwa 33 kg geerntet. Gepflanzt haben wir ihn in 3 Reihen, 25 x 30 cm. Dreimal hatten wir ihn in der Gemüsekiste in diesem Jahr. Denke das ist mit einem Abstand von 5-8 Wochen ganz optimal. Dann kann er auch gut nachwachsen. Die Sorte heißt Nero di Toscana. 🌱
Wie sind Eure Erfahrungen mit Palmkohl? Oder auch Schwarzkohl oder Federkohl genannt. 
———
#palmkohl #schwarzkohl #federkohl #kohlanbau #marketfarming #marketgardening #smallscalefarming #lokaleinkaufen #lokalelebensmittel #lokalelebensmittelzumfairenpreis #gemüsezeit #gemüsezeitaltluneberg

Spicy mustard, cress and oriental leaves, bitter sweet chicory and endives, and mild winter purslane, lettuce and baby kale, spinach, chard leaves... There's at least 20 varieties of leaf in there!
Here's 10kg harvested this morning, packed up for the people around Pitney, we hope you enjoy!

node.text: A snowy winter harvest of spinach. This spinach type is Olympia and it isn’t even that winter hardy but here in zone 6 it’s doing just fine! It was under 6 inches of snow for about two nights. One of those nights had freezing temps. I did not cover it because I don’t want to keep harvesting it through the winter. So putting up a row cover just for one harvest didn’t make much sense to me when I knew the warmer temps today and tomorrow will wash away most of the snow (it did!). Snow is a wonderful insulator for crops. Other cold hardy crops are: kale, collards, beets, carrots, storage radishes, spinach, tatsoi and others ❄️ this lovely spinach is going to @dufferingrovemarket and to the people that ordered online through my Farm Store!

node.text:
Repost from @theseedfarm: Equipment spotlight ⚡️ Meet the BCS walk-behind tractor, a versatile piece of equipment that’s great for larger gardens and smaller farms. It’s also a great choice for beginning farmers, since it is easier to maneuver and more affordable than a traditional tractor. 
No tractor is affordable or efficient enough, though, if you don’t know how to use it properly and don’t have the right implements for your job. That’s why we offer equipment training and make the BCS walk-behind available to incubator farmers. With training and experience, you will be better informed and prepared to make smart purchasing decisions for your new farm business.
 (Shown in the high tunnel with @nickthegrower during the 2016 training season!)

#marketfarming #equipment #bcs #bcstractor #walkbehindtractor #farm #farming #marketgarden #smallscalefarming #theseedfarm #beginningfarmer #efficiency #farmlife #farmequipment #madeinitaly #bcsworldwide

node.text:
This week, we are giving thanks to the sponsors who made #goodfoodforall a reality in 2020. 
•
Our John Deere 5075 was collaboratively sponsored by @generalmills and @sclark4606 on behalf of her late father, Martin Clark. Martin was an early pioneer of landrace hogs in Iowa and, as it happens, wouldn’t touch a tractor that wasn’t green. This machine is the true workhorse of the Grow farm. We use it for tillage, mowing, moving materials, and just about anything else. It’s a real beaut too. Many thanks to these two generous donors for keeping the tractor running in 2020. 
•
•
#smallfarms #organicfarming #smallscalefarming #organicfarmers #iowafarm #thisisiowa #growjc2020 #goodfoodforall #goodfoodisahumanright #iowaoutdoors #iowacity #iowafarmers #thinkiowacity #sustainableagriculture

node.text:
Remember, that in the next few weeks you're invited on my foraging excursion. Back on this matter because 1) I need to finish this convo and 2) we have some good stuff growing on the farm! Again, this is NOT #trametesversicolor aka #turkeytailmushrooms; rather, it's #stereumostrea mainly because the undersides are smooth. Turkeys have a rough surface w/ visible pores... 
::
FYI, whether a poisonous species or not it's OK to touch the mushies with bare hands! Remember that foraging involves several senses simultaneously; with touch being an important one...

node.text:
Back by popular demand, "make and take" your own evergreen wreath! 
We had a great time last year making these one of a kind wreaths with handcut evergreen trimmings from our properties, and we're doing it again this year!
THIS year,  I am collaborating with a local Sparta business to have this event at a new swanky location! 😉
Classes will be limited in size, so stay tuned for details! 
#shoplocalsparta #spartafirst #Spartatn #smallscalefarming #foraging #diy

The bok choy has settled into its new home and taking off. Trying to get in some waterings before it gets to cold. 

The weather in Charlotte has been decent compared with the rest of Vermont allowing these transplants to take hold quickly. Soon as the the temperatures begin to decline we will cover them with a single layer of remay to help retain some of the heat from the day to keep them warm throughout the night. 

Our sensors recorded a high of 70F in the greenhouse yesterday and a low of 24F and this is where the remay will help level out those temperatures a bit better as it starts to get colder. We will start with a single layer of remay and go as long as we can before we apply the second layer. The remay helps trap in the heat but also limits the amount of sunlight so as few layers as possible is always the best. Let us know how your winter gardens are going.

I’m honored to support this Indigenous-led collaborative post. It invites proponents of western ecological agriculture (like us #slowflowers and #notill folks) to go deeper—to not ‘take’ certain land practices from Indigenous cultures without their context, but to encompass deeper Indigenous worldviews. This post calls for a consciousness shift that will support us to go from a dominant culture of supremacy to one founded on reciprocity, respect, and interrelations with all beings—including, of course, among all humans.
.
The land that I farm was once inhabited and stewarded by the Munsee-Delaware nation. 
.
Follow and support the contributors to this collaborative piece: @CulturalSurvival [WaitahaExecutiveGrandmothersCouncil.com] @Fog_Moon_Studio @NEN_NorthEastNetwork [SaltNet.org] [CikodGhana.org] @EarthIsOhana [RegenAgAlliance.org] @Linda.Black.Elk @GreenstoneFarm_LA @CulturalConservancy @NatKelley @GatherFilm @AGrowingCulture @Terralingua.Langscape @FarmerRishi @KameaChayne
.
To join us in sharing this open-source post, head to: bit.ly/IndigenousWorldViews
.
#slowflowersmovement #seasonalfloweralliance #ulstercounty #rondoutvalley #rondoutvalleygrowers #kingstonny #smallscalefarming

Next batch of chooks loving their latest patch of weeds and grasses. They are scratching, eating and walking all over the plants to lay down a thick mulch. This is helping us to start to form a rich layer of humus on top of the soil 🍂

Come grab your soil building chicken from the @mullumfarmersmkt this Friday. We sold out fast last week so get in early to avoid disappointment. 

🐓🐓🐓

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
